org.mxupdate.install
Class Insert_mxJPO

java.lang.Object
  org.mxupdate.install.Insert_mxJPO

public class Insert_mxJPO
extends Object

The JPO is used to install the Mx Update JPO file package. Because the Mx update JPO classes are using imports and Matrix could not handle imports of JPO classes, the complete MQL insert is rewritten.

Version:
$Id: Insert_mxJPO.java 593 2009-10-19 07:31:58Z tim.moxter $
Author:
The MxUpdate Team

Field Detail

PROP_FILEDATE

private static final String PROP_FILEDATE
Name of the JPO property holding the last modified date of the file.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PROP_COMPILED

private static final String PROP_COMPILED
Name of the JPO property holding the information if a MxUpdate JPO is already compiled. The value false means that a complete compile with force update must be done.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

CMD_LISTJPOS

private static final String CMD_LISTJPOS
MQL command line to list the installed MxUpdate JPOs and the depending last modified date of the installed file.

See Also:
evaluteInstalledJPOs(Context, SimpleDateFormat), Constant Field Values

Constructor Detail

Insert_mxJPO

public Insert_mxJPO()
Method Detail

mxMain

public void mxMain(matrix.db.Context _context,
                   String[] _args)
            throws Exception
Inserts all MxUpdate JPOs which are changed.

Parameters:
_context - context for this request
_args - arguments from the MX console:
  • first parameter is the root path
  • second parameter is the MxUpdate version
  • third parameter is the format of the date / time
Throws:
Exception - if installation of the MxUpdate JPOs failed

evaluteInstalledJPOs

protected Map<String,Date> evaluteInstalledJPOs(matrix.db.Context _context,
                                                SimpleDateFormat _dateFormat)
                                         throws matrix.util.MatrixException
Searches for the installed JPOs and returns them including the information about the last modified date of the installed file. If a program is found which is not a JPO and does not have the extension .properties, an information is printed that the program is ignored.

Parameters:
_context - context for this request
_dateFormat - date / time formatter
Returns:
map of already installed JPOs and the last modified date of the installed file
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the installed JPOs could not be evaluated
See Also:
CMD_LISTJPOS

update

public void update(matrix.db.Context _context,
                   JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile _classFile,
                   String _version,
                   SimpleDateFormat _dateFormat)
            throws IOException,
                   matrix.util.MatrixException
Because there is a different behavior for backslashes between MX versions, the JPO program must be included. So the source code is only updated so that the source code includes for all used classes the depending package names.

Parameters:
_context - context for this request
_classFile - class file instance (represents the JPO which must be updates)
_version - application version
_dateFormat - date / time formatter
Throws:
IOException - if the JPO file could not be read
matrix.util.MatrixException - if the JPO could not updated
See Also:
JPOHandler_mxJPO.ClassFile.getCode()

execMql

protected String execMql(matrix.db.Context _context,
                         CharSequence _cmd)
                  throws matrix.util.MatrixException
Executes given MQL command and returns the trimmed result of the MQL execution.

Parameters:
_context - MX context for this request
_cmd - MQL command to execute
Returns:
trimmed result of the MQL execution
Throws:
matrix.util.MatrixException - if MQL execution failed; includes the MQL command if _includeMQLCommand is set to true

convertMql

public String convertMql(CharSequence _text)
Converts given string by escaping the " so that in escape mode on string could be handled with " and '.

Parameters:
_text - character stream to convert
Returns:
converted string
